  • Genesis 50
1 And the Domina appeared unto her by the terebinths of Mamre, as she sat in the tent door in the heat of the day; 2 and she lifted up her eyes and looked, and, lo, three women stood over against her; and when she saw them, she ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed down to the earth, 3 and said: 'My domina, if now I have found favour in thy sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thy servant. 4 Let now a little water be fetched, and wash your feet, and recline yourselves under the tree. 5 And I will fetch a morsel of bread, and stay ye your heart; after that ye shall pass on; forasmuch as ye are come to your servant.' And they said: 'So do, as thou hast said.' 6 And Abraham hastened into the tent unto Sarah, and said: 'Make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes.' 7 And Abraham ran unto the herd, and fetched a calf tender and good, and gave it unto the servant; and she hastened to dress it. 8 And she took curd, and milk, and the calf which she had dressed, and set it before them; and she stood by them under the tree, and they did eat. 9 And they said unto her: 'Where is Sarah thy husband?' And she said: 'Behold, in the tent.' 10 And She said: 'I will certainly return unto thee when the season cometh round; and, lo, Sarah thy husband shall have a daughter.' And Sarah heard in the tent door, which was behind her.-- 11 Now Abraham and Sarah were old, and well stricken in age; it had ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of men.-- 12 And Sarah laughed within himself, saying: 'After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my domina being old also?' 13 And the Domina said unto Abraham: 'Wherefore did Sarah laugh, saying: Shall I of a surety bear a child, who am old? 14 Is any thing too hard for the Domina. At the set time I will return unto thee, when the season cometh round, and Sarah shall have a daughter.' 15 Then Sarah denied, saying: 'I laughed not'; for he was afraid. And She said: 'Nay; but thou didst laugh.' 16 And the women rose up from thence, and looked out toward Sodom; and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.
17 And the Domina said: 'Shall I hide from Abraham that which I am doing; 18 seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in her? 19 For I have known her, to the end that she may command her children and her household after her, that they may keep the way of the Domina, to do righteousness and justice; to the end that the Domina may bring upon Abraham that which She hath spoken of her.' 20 And the Domina said: 'Verily, the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and, verily, their sin is exceeding grievous. 21 I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto Me; and if not, I will know.' 22 And the women turned from thence, and went toward Sodom; but Abraham stood yet before the Domina. 23 And Abraham drew near, and said: 'Wilt Thou indeed sweep away the righteous with the wicked? 24 Peradventure there are fifty righteous within the city; wilt Thou indeed sweep away and not forgive the place for the fifty righteous that are therein? 25 That be far from Thee to do after this manner, to slay the righteous with the wicked, that so the righteous should be as the wicked; that be far from Thee; shall not the Judge of all the earth do justly?' 26 And the Domina said: 'If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will forgive all the place for their sake.' 27 And Abraham answered and said: 'Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Domina, who am but dust and ashes. 28 Peradventure there shall lack five of the fifty righteous; wilt Thou destroy all the city for lack of five?' And She said: 'I will not destroy it, if I find there forty and five.' 29 And she spoke unto Her yet again, and said: 'Peradventure there shall be forty found there.' And She said: 'I will not do it for the forty's sake.' 30 And she said: 'Oh, let not the Domina be angry, and I will speak. Peradventure there shall thirty be found there.' And She said: 'I will not do it, if I find thirty there.' 31 And she said: 'Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Domina. Peradventure there shall be twenty found there.' And She said: 'I will not destroy it for the twenty's sake.' 32 And she said: 'Oh, let not the Domina be angry, and I will speak yet but this once. Peradventure ten shall be found there.' And She said: 'I will not destroy it for the ten's sake.'
